Record.CAVI-Lemma: Frs. of BF cup. Unattributed. Last quarter sixth. 520-500 (Villard).

Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Nonsense(?): A: to right of the charioteer's head: [--]οσγ[--]. A photo in CVA also seems to show letters in front of the horses of one of the two chariots.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Frs. of Gordion cup. From Naukratis. Kleitias. Ergotimos, potter. Second quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Inscriptions: Handle zone: A: [Ε]ργοτιμος ε[πο]ιεσεν. B: [Κλιτι]ας :* εγραφσεν.
Record.CAVI-Comments: + 1948.8-15.2 + 88.6-1.125, 424 (B 601.4.1 and 2) and 427 (B 601.5) + Cambridge N 206: six frs. On Kleitias' handwriting see AttScr (1990), 24-26. Early writing.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: Gardner (1888), 828/827, pl. 21. — Beazley–Payne (1929), pl. 17/16, figs. 13, 14 and 16 (good for inscriptions). — Beazley (1932), 186 (not ill.). — W. Lamb, CVA Cambridge 2, Great Britain 11 (1936), pl. 21,11 (Cambridge fr.). — Robertson (1951), 145/1 (all frs.). — ABV (1956), 78/14. — Johnston (1978c), no. 19 (not ill.) (the same fr.). — AttScr (1990), no. 218.

Publication.Publication-Name: Hirayama, T., Kleitias and Attic Black-Figure Vases in the Sixth-Century B.C. (Tokyo, 2010)

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Frs. of BF Gordion cup. From Naukratis. Kleitias. Second quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: Int.: part of picture, palmette, and border.
Record.CAVI-Comments: + 324 + 426 (B 601.4.3) + 1948.8-15.3 and 4. Taken from ABV. Five frs.

Publication.Publication-Name: Hirayama, T., Kleitias and Attic Black-Figure Vases in the Sixth-Century B.C. (Tokyo, 2010)

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Frs. of cup (similar to a Gordion cup). From Naukratis. Unattributed. Second quarter sixth. 560-550.
Record.CAVI-Comments: + B 601.10. Robertson combined the frs.; the reading is his, but given in ABV as [καλον ειμ]ι ποτερι[ον], saying that only two letters are complete. I reproduce what I saw in the photo. Rhodes 10,527, signed Eucheiros, has καλον : ειμι ποτ[ε]ριον, " a glyconic," ABV. "The lettering on the following fragments connects them with the remains of Gordion cups by Kleitias in London," ABV 79. C. Smith and the BM Cat. doubtfully thought of a signature of Eucheiros; this is repeated as certain by Hoppin. Beazley in JHS 52 connected 601.10 (= A) with other Naukratis frs., but the connection was later abandoned.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Frs. of Gordion cup (two frs.). From Naukratis. Unattributed. Sondros, potter (?). Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Comments: = B 601.6.3. + 88.6-1.432 (= B 602.6.4). The distribution of frs. after M. Robertson. Cf. also AttScr (1990), 52. Three-stroke sigma.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} if both frs. are from A; if they are from different sides, we have: A: Σον[δρος ---] and B: [---ε]ποιεσεν, with no guarantee that Sondros is the potter (although this is very likely).
Record.AVI-Bibliography: Beazley–Payne (1929), pl. 17, figs. 15 and 18. — Beazley (1932), 186 (combined with other frs.). — Robertson (1951), 147/5. — ABV (1956), 173/2.

Publication.Publication-Name: Carpenter, T.H., with Mannack, T. and Mendonca, M., Beazley Addenda, 2nd edition (Oxford, 1989)

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Fr. of Gordion cup. From Naukratis. Unattributed. Sondros, potter (?). Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Comments: = B 601.6.2. + Cambridge N 125. The distribution of frs. after M. Robertson. Cf. also AttScr (1990), 52. Three-stroke sigma.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} so ABV; but the restoration depends on London 88.6-1.431+, q.v.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: Beazley–Payne (1929), pl. 17, fig. 17 (London fr.). — Beazley (1932), 186 (combined with another fr.). — W. Lamb, CVA Cambridge 2, Great Britain 11 (1936), pl. 21,8 (Cambridge fr.). — Robertson (1951), 147/6 (both frs.). — ABV (1956), 173/3.

Record.CAVI-Lemma: Frs. of Gordion or LM cup. From Naukratis. Unattributed. Sondros, potter (?). Third quarter sixth.
Record.CAVI-Subject: Int.: part of the border remains. Ext.: no figured decoration.
Record.CAVI-Footnotes: {1} so ABV; but the restoration depends on London 88.6-1.431+, q.v.
Record.AVI-Bibliography: Beazley–Payne (1929), pl. 17, fig. 11 (one fr.). — Beazley (1932), 186. — Robertson (1951), 147/7 (both frs). — ABV (1956), 173/4. — AttScr (1990), 52 [[mention]].
